definition: to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
to jab/to poke/to stab/to sprain/to blunt/to fuck (vulgar)/to stand sth upright
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: The new generation tide male kid, burst your traditional thinking.
sentences.chinese: 新世代潮男小鬼，戳破你的传统想法。

sentences.english: But she does want to explode some myths.
sentences.chinese: 不过，她的确想戳破一些神话。

sentences.english: Pricking them is even harder without wrecking the economy.
sentences.chinese: 在不伤害经济的情况下戳破泡沫则更难。

sentences.english: Let out the secret and it is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 戳破这窗户纸就一文不值。

sentences.english: My car has had two punctures this week.
sentences.chinese: 这个星期我的汽车轮胎被戳破两次。

definition: to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
